item.title: Startup Playbook: a startup framework
item.description: I found an startup playbook that is created by Sam Altman, former president of Y Combinator. It's a great website if anyone wants to start their company in the future. Here is the summery of this playbook and some of my thoughts: The Idea This is the most important part of starting a startup. A startup needs to focus on what it is solving and who needs this product. It's not like you can think of a idea overnight, I think sometimes a good idea came from stupid, shitty topic.
